tool_description: Analyzes correlations between incident characteristics and severity outcomes to identify factors that influence injury severity.

dataset_id.description: Identifier for the classified incident dataset

severity_field.description: Name of the field containing severity information

correlation_method.description: Statistical method: pearson, spearman, or kendall

error_messages: Dataset not found: Ensure dataset_id refers to a valid classified dataset.
Missing severity field: The specified severity_field does not exist in the dataset.
Invalid correlation factors: At least one correlation factor must be specified.
Unsupported correlation method: Use pearson, spearman, or kendall.
Invalid significance level: Value must be between 0.01 and 0.10.
Insufficient data: Not enough data points for reliable correlation analysis.
usage: Provide dataset_id, severity_field, and correlation_factors. Choose appropriate correlation_method for your data type. Set significance_level for statistical testing.

significant_correlations.description: Factors showing statistically significant correlation with severity

correlation_coefficients.description: Correlation coefficients for each analyzed factor

risk_factors.description: Top factors associated with higher severity outcomes

protective_factors.description: Factors associated with lower severity outcomes
